dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolute bedlam. 300 drunken STOCKBROKERS, most in their early 20s, chant wildly as JORDAN BELFORT, handsome, 30, stands beside a DWARF dressed in tights, cape & helme

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty five grand to the first cocksucker to nail a bullseye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "bullseye" is a large dollar sign in the middle of a giant velcro "dartboard".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street      Buff Revised Pages    3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch and learn, people!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Brokers go apeshit as Jordan grabs the Dwarf by his pants and collar. In the Crowd, cash flies as side bets are made. Jordan winds up, aims for the "dartboard".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One.   Two.      Throw!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Brokers cheer, and as the screaming Dwarf takes flight, hurtling toward camera, we FREEZE FRAME:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Jordan Belfort. No, not                      * him, me. I'm a former member of                         * the middle class raised by two accountants in a tiny apartment in Bayside, Queens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan, 7, smiles as he poses behind a lemonade stand, his parents Max and Leah behind him; Jordan, 13, stands holding a styrofoam cooler, selling ices on the beach; Jordan, 18, smiles as he holds an Amway sales brochure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The year I turned 26, I made 49 million dollars as the head of my own brokerage firm--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CHERRY RED Ferrari Testarossa ZOOMS down the L.I.E.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --which really pissed me off because it was three shy of a million a week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ferrari weaves in and out of traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, my Ferrari was white, like Don Johnson's in Miami Vice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the same Ferrari, now in WHITE, as it zooms away, a BLONDE head bobbing up and down in Jordan's lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A twin-engine Bell Jet helicopter descends over a huge mansion, with sparkling pool, tennis court and waterfall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See that humongous estate down there? That's my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see NAOMI, 24, blonde and gorgeous, a living wet dream in LaPerla lingerie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife, Naomi, the Duchess of Bay Ridge, Brooklyn, a former model and Miller Lite girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naomi licks her lips; she's incredibly, painfully hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she was the one blowing me in the Ferrari, so put your dick back in your pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the following, WE SEE a quick

dialogues.speaker: 7-7C SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: All taken from TV; a mansion from Lifestyles of the Rich and Famous; wealthy PEOPLE applauding at a polo match; a yacht sailing crystal blue seas; Robert Wagner and Stephanie Powers toasting with champagne on Hart to Hart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In addition to Naomi and my two perfect kids, I own a mansion, private jet, six cars, three horses, two vacation homes and a 170 foot yacht.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweaty, wild-eyed and naked, Jordan fucks an HISPANIC HOOKER from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I also gamble like a degenerate, drink like a fish, fuck hookers maybe five times a week and have three different Federal agencies looking to indict me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dismounts, snorts some coke through a straw, then uses it to blow some into her asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, and I love drugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages      3/5/13 Jordan looks up suddenly, paranoid, as if he's hearing voices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan, drooling and stoned out of his skull, wears a rumpled custom-made business suit as he mans a set of controls next to his frantic co-pilot, CAPTAIN DAVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull up!   Jesus! We're gonna crash!! Jordan's head bobs as he pulls back on the stick. The helicopter rises sharply, then levels out, hovering 30 feet above a huge mansion. Down below, through Jordan's hazy, DOUBLE VISIONED POV, we see a sparkling pool, tennis court and waterfall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check this out -- despite my completely fucked-up state, I could fly straight while still seeing two of everything. He closes one eye; his POV sharpens. Putting pressure on the stick, the helicopter descends slowly over the driving range... then LURCHES and SLAMS to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Captain Dave)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya guzza git hazarous doozy pay, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning. Sober now, impeccable in suit and tie, Jordan heads for the door holding a glass of orange juice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, on a daily basis I take enough drugs to sedate greater Long Island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pops two white pills, swigs some juice, then speaks directly to the camera as he heads for a waiting limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take Quaaludes for my back, fifteen to twenty a day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I use Xanax to stay focused, ambien to sleep, pot to mellow out, cocaine to wake up and morphine because it's awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limo pulls up to the black glass office building. Jordan gets out, heads inside through a back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But of all the drugs under God's blue heaven, there's one that's my absolute favorite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gadgets, computers, oxblood leather furniture. With the DIN of the brokerage firm bleeding in, Jordan uses a credit card to cut a line of coke on his desk. As he peels a crisp $100 DOLLAR BILL off a wad, rolls it up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough of this shit'll make you invincible, able to conquer the world and eviscerate your enemies. He SNARFS up the line, gestures to the cocaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not talking about this. I'm talking about this. (Jordan unfurls the $100 with a SNAP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money is the oxygen of capitalism and I wanna breathe more than any other human being alive. He crumbles it into a ball and tosses it into a corner, where it comes to rest with two dozen others. Over his back as we TRACK HIM out of his office toward what sounds like the ROAR of a mob--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money doesn't just buy you a better life -- better food, better cars, better pussy -- it also makes you a better person. You can give generously to the church of your choice or the political party. You can save the fucking spotted owl with money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street    Buff Revised Pages    3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arms akimbo, Jordan stands above the bullpen, a huge open space with tightly packed rows of maple colored desks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But most of all, in any country in the world, money can buy you love. Fuck the Beatles. His 300 BROKERS, mostly young men with their jackets off, scream wildly. They worship him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that in mind, at the tender age of 22, after marrying my girlfriend Teresa--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An express bus pull up -- its sign reads "Wall Street"....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --I headed to the only place that befit my high-minded ambitions... Jordan emerges, kisses TERESA goodbye, then joins a sea of Commuters heading to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are lower than fucking pond scum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computers, telephones everywhere. At their desks, 45 shirt-sleeved BROKERS read their Wall St. Journals, readying for war. Like an eager puppy, Jordan follows broker JERRY FOGEL, 30, thick-lipped and bow-tied...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a problem with that? (reads name tag)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.   No problem at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street    Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your job is `connector', which means you'll be dialing the phone over 500 times a day, trying to `connect' me with business owners. And till you pass your Series 7, that's all you'll be doing. Sit. Jordan takes a seat at the desk next to Fogel's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just so you know, last year I made over 300k and the other guy you'll be working for made a million.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A million dollars? I could only imagine what a douchebag that guy must be. A manicured hand lands on Jordan's shoulder. It's MARK HANNA, 30s, charismatic, movie-star handsome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan? Mark Hanna. (re: Fogel) Good, you've met Jerry. One of the smartest guys in the office. Who's ever sucked a dog's cock out of loneliness. Fogel's smile turns to a frown.      He hands Jordan a st of 3x5 index cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smile and dial. And don't pick your fucking head up till one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mind Jerry, his father raped him as a child. Besides, I'm senior broker here, he's a worthless piker. I heard you pitched stock at your job interview.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had to do something to stand out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fuckin' love that! Let's grab lunch later. Windows good with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.   Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street    Buff Revised Pages    3/5/13 Hanna gives him a wink, looks at the clock on the giant electronic stock ticker encircling the room -- 9:30 a.m.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's fuck!! RING!!! Absolute pandemonium at the BELL signalling the opening of the stock market. Feet fly off desks; Brokers and their Connectors dial phones like mad. The CAMERA PUSHES IN on JORDAN, mesmerized as he takes in the ROAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Broker #2) Miniscribe's a fuckin' steal! Thirty eight bucks a share!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into headset) Your broker in West Virginia? What are you buying, a coal mine? It's the 80s, the game is high- tech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Broker #3) Fuckface! I got 50,000 July 50s!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to know what money sounds like? Visit a trading floor on Wall Street. Fuck this, shit that. Cock, cunt, asshole. I couldn't believe how these guys talked to each other-- Fogel notices Jordan sitting there frozen.        He cove mouthpiece, kicks the desk violently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dial the cocksucking phone! Jordan snaps out of it, starts dialing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was hooked within seconds. Mark Hanna slams down his phone in victory, scrawls out a "buy" ticket. He places the ticket into a glass cylinder which he slips into a plastic pneumatic tube.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was like mainlining adrenaline. The tube is WHOOSHED into the ceiling and we're suddenly-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a COKE SPOON whose contents disappear up a nostril. PULL BACK TO REVEAL... The lunchtime power spot with panoramic views of the city. At a corner table, a paranoid Jordan looks around as Hanna does another bump of coke. None of the other DINERS seem to notice or care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offering the spoon)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got enough for one more? Tootski?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   Thanks though. Hanna slips the vial into his pocket as HECTOR, the tuxedoed Maitre'D, approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Hanna, what can I bring for you on this glorious afternoon? Hanna surreptitiously palms Hector a $100; Jordan notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the game plan, Hector. Bring us two Absolut Martinis straight up. Precisely seven and a half minutes after you deliver those you'll bring two more, then two more every five minutes until one of us passes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An excellent strategy, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I'm good with 7-Up. Jordan might as well have farted at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First day on Wall Street, Hector. Give him time. (Hector offers menus)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks, I'm not eating. Hector heads off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can get high during the day and still function?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High is the only way to do this fucking job. Guy who coined the term "three-martini lunch" was a woman. Cocaine and hookers, my friend, the keys to success. Jordan smiles, not sure if Hanna is kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta say, I'm really excited about being part of your team. I wanna do all I can for our clients and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reciting an ad) "Here at L.F. Rothschild, our clients aren't just important, they're family." Just as long as we get our taste first. Remember something, Jordan, your top priority in this job: make us money. If the clients get rich along the way, bully for them. Got a girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wife.   She cuts hair. Mark swallows a comment about that.      Gets to business

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, first rule of Wall Street. Nobody -- and I don't care if you're Warren Buffet or Jimmy Buffet -- nobody knows if a stock's going up, down or fucking sideways, least of all stock brokers. But we have to pretend we know. Make sure you stay relaxed. Nobody wants to buy something from someone who sounds like they haven't gotten laid in a month. Take breaks when you feel stressed, jerk off if you can. You like jerking off, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, jerking off is key. And I highly recommend cocaine, which will make you dial faster, which is good for me. Churn `em and burn `em, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13 A BUSBOY stops by with a fresh napkin for Mark who thanks him. Then, discreetly as possible, Mark removes a fresh vial of cocaine tucked within and takes a quick snort. Jordan realizes: that's why he palmed the maitre d' $100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the next six months I learned the ways of Wall Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As STRIPPERS grind in b.g, Jordan parties with Mark Hanna and dozens of BROKERS and TRAINEES. Jordan sips a martini and studies Mark Hanna, hitting on a STRIPPER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That fall I passed my Series 7. Finally it was here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Briefcase in hand, Jordan boards the elevator with a dozen other BROKERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My first day as a stockbroker, a future Master of the Universe. And as the doors close, on screen WE SEE: OCTOBER 19th, 1987

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Total chaos. Jordan dials the phone as all around him Brokers panic, screaming into headsets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They called it Black Monday. By four p.m. the market was down 508 points, the biggest one-day drop since the crash of `29. 4 p.m. The closing bell RINGS; the entire place goes silent. Brokers look at each other, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy.   Fucking. Shit. And as the Brokers start commiserating with each other...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street    Buff Revised Pages    3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: L.F. Rothschild, a company that had been in business since 1883, closed its doors within a month. 25   INT. JORDAN & TERESA'S APARTMENT - KITCHEN - DAY Jordan sits at the table perusing the Times classifieds. Teresa approaches with two coffees. Sits next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I'll take an extra shift, don't worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You work too much as it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could pawn my engagement ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not pawning anything. I'm gonna be a millionaire, Teresa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know that doesn't matter, right? He smiles, kisses her.     Together, they peruse the ads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points to an ad)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Nobody Beats the Wiz".      I could be a stock boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a stock broker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's hiring brokers right now, sweetie. They go back to the ads.     After a few beats, she point

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a suit, Jordan emerges from an `85 Datsun. He looks around confused, heads toward an unmarked storefront.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The antithesis of L.F. Rothschild, with cheap furniture and a dozen misfit "BROKERS" giving loud, obnoxious sales pitches. Jordan enters, a modern man among cave people. DWAYNE, slovenly, 35, with a walrus mustache, looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for Investor's Center?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's us, hey. Dwayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as they shake hands)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan Belfort, I called earlier. I was a broker with Rothschild. Dwayne motions Jordan to a seat. Nearby, a Broker in ratty Keds, TOBY WELCH, is screaming into his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tellin' you, this stock is goin' up!... Cause I know, okay?!... I have inside information! Jordan looks at him, appalled at what he's hearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are your quotrons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No quotrons, we sell off the pink sheets -- penny stocks. Dwayne slides Jordan a large thin book; its pages are literally pink. He explains as Jordan flips the pages:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Company don't have enough capital to be listed on NASDAQ, their shares trade here. (points to the book)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like these guys, Aerotyne? They make radar detectors out of a garage in Dubuque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six cents a share? Who buys this crap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schmucks mostly. Mailmen, plumbers, people thinking they can get rich quick. They answer our ads, Popular Mechanics, Hustler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages    3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spread on these is huge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So's your commission, that's the point. Blue chips stocks you get what, one percent? Pink sheets are fifty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second. You're telling me if I sell two thousand dollars worth of stock, my commission is a thousand bucks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Technically, yeah, but not even the biggest schmuck buys two thousand dollars of this shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As others Brokers bark into phones, Jordan sits, phone cradled in his shoulder, making notes. A few beats, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Fleming, good morning, Jordan Belfort with Investor's Center in New York City. You recently responded to one of our ads... A few of the other Brokers glance over, eavesdropping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reason I'm calling is that an extremely exciting investment opportunity crossed my desk today. Typically our firm recommends no more than five stocks per year: this is one of them... A few more Brokers look over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aerotyne International is a cutting edge tech firm out of the Midwest, awaiting imminent patent approval on a new generation of radar equipment... LATER.   Now all the Brokers listen in rapt attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- so if Aerotyne's shares rise to only a dollar -- and our research indicates they could go much, much higher -- your profit on a mere three thousand dollar investment would be upwards of fifty thousand... That's right, you could pay off your mortgage. Seconds tick by; an eternity, then he starts writing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four thousand dollars, will that be check or money order?... Thank you, sir. Jordan hangs up, scrawls out a "buy" ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like that I made two grand. The other guys looked at me like I'd just discovered fire. Toby Welch and the other cave-Brokers stare at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you fuckin' do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan sits at his desk in mid-pitch, totally focused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a rock-solid company, sir, it's the next Microsoft... Six thousand. Terrific. As Jordan continues talking, wrapping up the sale...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Though I knew I was selling garbage, within twelve weeks I was making a fortune. And as he starts scrawling out a buy ticket...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as a wise man once told me, my only responsibility was to put meat on the table. CLOSE ON a 1988 Jaguar, parked outside a diner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street     Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing a suit, Jordan sits in a booth reading the Wall Street Journal as a WAITRESS serves the food. DONNIE AZOFF, preppy-looking, 25, with horn-rims and bright white teeth approaches from the takeout counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That your Jag in the lot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice ride.      Donnie Azoff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan Belfort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen it around. We live in the same building. Twelfth floor? (Jordan nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you do, bro?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stock broker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids furniture, me and my brother- in-law. Making any money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventy grand last month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck out. You made seventy grand in one month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventy two actually. Donnie studies him, isn't sure if he's full of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what. You show me a pay stub with $72,000 on it, I'm quitting my job right now and coming to work with you. As Jordan retrieves his briefcase to find a paystub --

dialogues.speaker: 30A SCENE 30A OMITTED
dialogues.text: 30B   As Jordan hands Donnie his paystub and sure enough, north of seventy-two k.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages    3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit. Jordan watches as Donnie crosses to a pay phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he did quit his job, which I thought was a little weird. I mean I had just met this fucking guy. A few beats, then into phone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo Paulie, it's Donnie...     Yeah, listen, I quit. Jordan studies Donnie as he continues his conversation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were other things about him too, like his phosphorescent white teeth and the fact that he wore horn rims with clear lenses to look more Waspy. He also married his first cousin --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan sits in mid-conversation with Donnie over beers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem, if we have a kid who's a retard, we'll just leave it on the steps of some institution. And as they continue drinking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was also a closet drug fiend. I'd known him less than a week before he talked me into smoking crack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan and Donnie get high. Donnie holds a flame under a crack pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages    3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The weird thing was when he'd do crack, his face would contort into this bizarre, frozen mask like the Phantom of the Opera. Donnie does a hit of crack; his jaw twitches, then his facial muscles contort, locking up like a stroke victim. After a few beats, he hands the pipe to Jordan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You now, take a hit! Jordan takes a deep hit and holds it.      A beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Omigod, I fuckin' love you!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew I had to make him my partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan looks on as Donnie works the phone like a madman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which turned out to be a great move - Donnie was a fast learner who transitioned into the penny stock business quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan and Donnie pull up to a defunct auto body shop, which has a "For Lease" sign in the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So within months we started our own firm out of an abandoned auto body shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan sits with CHESTER MING, ROBBIE FEINBERG, ALDEN KUPFERBERG ("SEA OTTER") and BRAD, muscular and bald, with a Fu Manchu mustache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In addition to Donnie, I also recruited my friends Sea Otter,                        * Chester and Robbie, who were at                        * the time all middling pot dealers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages    3/5/13 As a WAITRESS serves cheeseburgers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --see everyone wants to get rich, so you're already half way there by the time the call starts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sold weed once to this Amish dude, had one of those beards with no mustache?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He only wanted to make furniture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that got to do with anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just said everyone wants to get rich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jordan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's true, you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddhists too, they don't give a shit about money either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man I could sell weed to anybody, get a convent full of nuns fucking wasted. And as Brad looks at Jordan and shakes his head:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the above guys working the phones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad, the guy I really wanted, took a pass, since he'd become the Quaalude king of Bayside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bare-chested, wearing kung fu pants, Brad sells ludes to a couple of HIGH SCHOOL KIDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street     Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were absolute morons, my friends, but like I always said--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan emerges from his office into the garage area (the bullpen), looking on as Donnie, Chester, Robbie, Sea Otter and four other BROKERS (now including RUGRAT and Toby) make sales calls from the cheap desks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me them young, hungry and stupid and in no time I'll make them rich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On lounge chairs at the edge of a dock, bottle of wine nearby, Jordan sits with Teresa. He smiles as she opens a jewelry case -- inside is a diamond tennis bracelet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Omigod.   Jordan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful. Jordan helps her try it on.       She smiles, but he dete wave of... something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're small, I know, but the stones are really high quality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no.   I love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what? They sit in silence.       Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, it's just -- these stocks, these crappy companies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In five years the Corleone family will be completely legitimate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't you be legitimate now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not illegal, Teresa, technically. I mean they're real stocks, they're just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never gonna make anybody money. (a few beats; then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't you feel better selling this junk to rich people, who can afford to lose the money at least?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rich people don't buy penny stocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? And on Jordan's look:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because they're too smart, that's why not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Jordan, brow furrowing as his wheels turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean what person of any substance would trust this bunch of jerk-offs? Like the Pinhead,                      * Robbie Feinberg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby Welch. I mean, look at this                     * fucking Cro-Magnon, I wouldn't                       * trust him to pick up a rock.                         * (ALT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby Welch. I mean, look at this                     * fucking Cro-Magnon, he couldn't                      * even think without moving his                        * lips.                                                *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or the Sea Otter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chester Ming even, the Depraved Chinaman, with his giant panda head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or Nicky Koskoff, who I called Rugrat because--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you can probably figure that out for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera PUSHES IN on Jordan as he stands before a large dry erase board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if they didn't sound like jerk-offs? What if I took this bunch of nincompoops and molded them in my own image? I reinvented the company, gave it a new image, a new name. Something patrician, blue-blooded, something that reeked of tradition and anti- semitism. And as his Brokers settle in to folding chairs--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, welcome to Stratton Oakmont.   The clients we've gone after in the past -- they're done. We will now target exclusively the wealthiest one percent of Americans. The methods we've used -- over. Loud, obnoxious sales hype is worthless with these people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In military terms it's like carpet- bombing -- noisy, menacing and only marginally effective. As Stratton brokers you will be laser- guided smart-bombs aimed at high- priority targets. You will establish an initial relationship with your clients selling only blue chip stocks -- then and only then will you attempt to sell the pink sheets, where the real money is. Now the key to every sale is this: Jordan writes the word "URGENCY" on the board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one buys stock unless he thinks it's going up and going up now. You must convince your client to buy before the takeover happens, before the lawsuit is settled, before the patent is granted. If he says I'll think about it and call you back, it's over, you're dead! No one calls back! So you have to create urgency --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another day. With Stratton Oakmont signage visible in the b.g., Jordan is on speakerphone with a potential CLIENT, the other Brokers listening in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and once Kodak settles the lawsuit, institutions will be permitted to buy their shares in large blocks again. And when that happens, which is any day now, what do you think will happen to the price of Kodak stock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll go up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. Which is why you should pick up 5000 shares today, a $200,000 investment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan stands addressing his Brokers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you lower your voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan pitches the client, his voice lowered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, sir, you will not be sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan stands before the Brokers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you wait. Whoever speaks first loses. At this point, where are we in the sale? Chester?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About to close?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you sweet and sour douchebag! We're at the beginning of the beginning! This is where the sale starts. You as a salesman are almost hoping he says no so you can finally do your fucking job!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan sits at the phone, waiting for a response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan stands before the Brokers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't know, he needs to think, he's gotta ask his wife! The fact is it doesn't matter what the fuck he says! If he's already agreed that the stock's going up, then the only real objection he has at this point is he doesn't trust you! And he shouldn't trust you, you're a fucking salesman! So what do you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie talks on the phone to a Client.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me ask you this, sir -- had I been your broker for the past three to four years and made you money on a consistent basis, you probably wouldn't say you need to think about it, you'd probably say pick me up three or four thousand shares, am I right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is crowded; now 20 Brokers make up the sales force. Sea Otter pitches a client.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second. You mean to tell me if I put you in Union Carbide at 7 and took you out at 32--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even more crowded, with 30 Brokers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I put you in Texas Instruments at 11 and took you out at 47--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More Brokers still - now there's 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Walmart at 16 and took you out at 95, you wouldn't say Chester pick me up 10,000 shares? C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well yeah, in that case I would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street    Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New offices now, a real brokerage firm. The bullpen is large, with 75 Brokers at polished maple desks, sitting before computers talking into headsets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the problem is that I don't have the luxury of a track record. Sir, let me reintroduce myself to you. My name is Donnie Azoff--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Nicky Koskoff--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chester Ming--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter DeBlasio from Stratton Oakmont in New York City--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and I plan on being the top broker in my firm this year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what about this? We start small with 500 shares, a cash outlay of $20,000.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the stock goes up 10%, will that make you a rich man? Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If if goes down 10%, will it make you a poor man? No..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages     3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What this trade will do is serve as a benchmark for future business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The downside is minimal and the upside is a long-term relationship with a broker on Wall Street who will consistently make you money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your only regret will be that I didn't call you six months ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Robbie Feinberg)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sea Otter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me 300 shares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Peter DeBlasio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1200 shares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jordan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take 5000 shares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4PM the place goes nuts as Jordan emerges from his office holding a spread sheet. He addresses the crowd of 100 BROKERS, which now includes a dozen WOMEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody have a good week? Applause; war whoops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to read you something. (reads spread sheet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Month end, March 1991! $28.7 million in gross commissions - all                  * in Stratton issues. Not bad for                     * penny stocks, huh boys? Not bad                     * for dumpin' penny stocks.                           * The place goes WILD with applause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And to celebrate with a weekly act of debauchery, I have offered our lovely sales assistant Danielle Harrison ten thousand dollars to                    * have her head shaved! Jordan motions to DANIELLE HARRISON, 19, pretty, sitting in a chair nearby. Behind her, Rugrat uses clippers to shave her thick brown mane. The place goes nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FYI, Danielle tells me she's using the money for breast implants! Is this a great company or what?!! More wild applause as Jordan signals across the bullpen to Donnie. We hear the opening strains of "Stars & Stripes Forever" as he opens the door to a

dialogues.speaker: COLLEGE MARCHING BAND
dialogues.text: dressed in underwear and hats. The music continues as somersaulting GYMNASTS and BATON-TWIRLERS bring up the rear. As they march through the bullpen to cheers-- FROM THE KITCHEN -- two dozen TUXEDO-CLAD WAITERS emerge carrying trays of champagne and hors d'oeuvres. The music continues as two dozen STRIPPERS bolt in, gyrating among the BROKERS. As Jordan surveys the insanity:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Word spread throughout Wall Street -- I was becoming a legend. Forbes Magazine even called to do a profile on me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan finishes up an interview with a FEMALE FORBES REPORTER - ALIYAH FARRAN. They shake hands, then he smiles for the camera - CLICK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A total fucking hatchet job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gorgeous place; city views. As Teresa sits nearby, a distraught Jordan paces, holding the copy of Forbes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That conniving little twat! (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The Wolf of Wall Street".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the bright side)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your hair looks good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Jordan Belfort, a twisted version of Robin Hood who takes from the rich and gives to himself and his merry band of brokers".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no such thing as bad publicity, sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bustling with activity. Jordan enters, crosses toward his office. Off to the side of the bullpen, he notices three dozen YOUNG MEN in business suits. He approaches his assistant JANET, 20s, dressed all in black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell's all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Forbes article.    They're applying for jobs. They spot Jordan, start clamoring, waving their resumes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Belfort!    Over here! Sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forbes had made me a superstar. Every day dozens of money-crazed kids beat a path to my door with resumes they hadn't even bothered to spellcheck. Jordan crosses through the packed bullpen, where 150 BROKERS, no older than 22, are crammed elbow to elbow talking into phones. Some have pets, which they tend to while they work -- iguanas, snakes, turtles, even a chimp. Others are getting shoulder rubs by Masseuses or being fitted for suits by a TAILOR. Over the above:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we hired `em, they dropped out of college overnight and blew whatever allowance they had on a new suit from our in-house tailor. The median age of our brokerage couldn't get served in the bar down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATRICK DENHAM sits sipping coffee as he reads Forbes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not this guy though -- what the fuck is he even doing here? He read the Forbes article, too, but he already had a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON two BROKERS wrestling while others cheer them on. PULL BACK to reveal the place from the opening. 300 young Brokers and their hot ASSISTANTS work the phones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Within months, we doubled in size, moved to even bigger offices. Two other Brokers pump themselves up, chest-bumping and screaming like football players.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a madhouse, a greed-fest, with equal parts cocaine, testosterone and body fluids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a stall, two Brokers snort coke, while another Broker fucks a Sales Assistant perched on the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to declare the office a fuck- free zone between the hours of 9 and 7, but even that didn't help. Taped to the mirror we see a MEMO -- inside a red circle, two anatomically correct stick figures fuck doggy-style, a red line slashing through them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually the madness started on our very first day, when one of our brokers, Ben Jenner, christened the elevator by getting a blowjob from a sales assistant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two dozen Brokers cheer, watching through the rising glass elevator as BEN JENNER, 25, gets a blowjob from a brunette SALES ASSISTANT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her name was Pam and   to her credit, she did have   an amazing technique, with this   wild twist and jerk motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Pam blows Jordan, Donnie fucks her from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eventually Ben married her, which was pretty amazing considering she blew every guy in the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wedding photo of Ben and Pam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He got depressed and killed himself three years later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crime scene photo; Ben in his underwear, dead on a bathroom floor, a gun near his head, which oozes blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, in an attempt to maintain order, I hired my dad Max as defacto CFO and head of the Gestapo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAX BELFORT sits smoking, watching a rerun of "The Equalizer" on TV. His wife, LEAH, does needlepoint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We called him Mad Max because of his hair-trigger temper, which could be set off by something as innocuous as a ringing telephone. The phone RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell has the goddamn gall to call this house on a Tuesday evening! Goddammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then the weirdest thing would happen. Though he'd never been near England, he'd pick up the phone and affect an ever-so-slight British accent. Greatly agitated, Max stomps toward the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was his other persona -- the super polite, ever-gracious Sir Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?... Yes, Gene, right-eo. Good-good then... Cheerio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was absolutely bizarre. He'd hang up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hangs up phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn fucking halfwit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And become Mad Max all over again. Max curses a blue streak as he stomps back to his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding a HEADSHOT of the Dwarf from the opening, Jordan sits talking with Donnie, Robbie and Rugrat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he gets hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be wearing a helmet. Plus they've got, like, superhuman strength anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did hear you're not supposed to                   * make direct eye contact. If you                     * look at them too long in their                      * eyes they get freaked out - their                   * wires cross.                                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think there's a limit to how far                  * we can go... I mean we can throw                    * shit at him and -                                   *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have a lot of feelings.                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a specific thing that                       * they'll do - You can throw him at                   * a dart board but if you want him                    * to show his cock or -                               *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, that's what this guy does.                     *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's his gift.                                    *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we also bowl with him?                          *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His brother is actually the                         * bowler.                                             *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They strap a skateboard to him and                  * throw him down an alley.                            *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're ornery, too, the little pricks. You gotta be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get some tranq darts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little straitjacket.                              *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the liability on something                   * like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a whole different thing. I                   * can get on the phone with some                      * people. I can talk to the                           * insurance company and tell them                     * exactly what we're going to do.                     * But I think we go back to the same                  * plan - loophole - if we don't                       * really consider them people I                       * think we are in the clear.                          *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should keep one in the                   * office because I think they're                      * good luck.                                          *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Treat it like the fuckin' thing it                  * is. He's coming in. We're paying                    * him for something. Treat him with                   * respect. And you just shake his                     * hand like you don't even think                      * anything's wrong.                                   *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just look like something else                   * is going on.                                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't look at his eyes.                         *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say "thank you for being here".                     *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't turn your back on him.                    * It's a sign of disrespect.                          *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want a cracker or something                  * - I'm gonna have some treats in my                  * pocket. I want to be in a strip                     * club with you guys. Literally pull                  * out a brief case and have a little                  * fuckin' guy pop out of there. You                   * know how much fuckin' pussy you                     * get?                                                *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The point is get it out.                            *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the jokes out now. Get the                      * fuckin' jokes out now.                              *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna fuck it up. Purge all                  * this shit right now.                                *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm saying -                            *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he comes in the room, I want                   * him to feel like a human being -                    *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Business. Business. It's fuckin'                    * business, bro.                                      *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want him to feel just like a                      * normal human being. Cause you know                  * - like one of us. One of us.                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like he's an actual human being.                    * One of us.                                          *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gobble, gobble we accept you, one                   * of us! One of us!                                   *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of us.                                          * Janet pokes her head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dad's coming. With the American Express bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you stop him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, you stop him. The guys straighten up and head to desk, settle in. Max blows in past her, waving a 3-inch-thick bill:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: $430,000 dollars in one month!! Four-hundred-and-thirty-thousand dollars in one month!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Father.                                      * (Max's expression doesn't budge)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're business expenses. Just                     * relax.                                              * The guys titter at "business expenses."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you bastards don't wipe those smug fucking looks off your faces, I swear to God I'm gonna wipe `em off for you! (back to Jordan) Are you insane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, Max, my portion of the bill is hardly anything, so I'm on the same page as you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up, Feinberg, you only have a portion because of my son, you worthless twerp!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckles) Twerp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You zip it, too, Azoff, those boiling teeth of yours are hurting my fucking eyes! (turning to Jordan) My own son! From my very loins! What do you think this is?                          *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you calm down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think there's any end in sight, do you? It's all one giant party to you schmendricks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds up AMEX bill)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: $26,000 for one dinner!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie ordered sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that was... Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glowering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is EJ Entertainment?     What is EJ Entertainment?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (restraining a grin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell me, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Of course after that bachelor party, the Duke needed a few penicillin shots so he could safely consummate the marriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jordan and Naomi mingle with a few Strattonites, videographer BARRY KLEINMAN, 40s, approaches Rugrat and his DATE, ABBY with a video camera:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street     Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Barry Kleinman, filming the wedding -- would you like to say something to Jordan and Naomi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck!      We love you! Across the way, Naomi spots someone through the crowd--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Omigod!   Aunt Emma! Naomi rushes over, hugs her AUNT EMMA, 50s, demure, British. Naomi turns, calls out to Jordan, who is now in a huddle with the guys, his back to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan!   Look! Jordan turns, then crosses to them, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan dear, how lovely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so nice to see you again. As he leans in to hug her, Aunt Emma spots some white powder on the edge of Jordan's nostril. Deftly, she wipes it off, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into the donuts, I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm--- uh... Aunt Emma leans in to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lived through the 60s, my dear. Enjoy the day. And with that, she turns back to Naomi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Naomi wearing a blindfold, Jordan leads her to the end of a long dock, expensive yachts moored everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful now.     You ready? Jordan removes her blindfold -- there, towering above the others, is a stunning, 120 foot yacht.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages      3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wedding present.       Check out the name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does; it's called "Naomi".     As she squeals, hugs h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For three weeks we sailed the Naomi through the Caribbean--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera PUSHES IN past a white-jacketed STEWARD, who opens the door to the yacht's main salon; next we see the living room, with its full bar and leather couches; then the bedroom, with a king bed and monogrammed sheets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --eventually taking her home to Long Island, where we'd bought a house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Naomi sails the calm waters, Jordan and Naomi popping ludes, sunbathing blissfully on the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven acres on the Gold Coast of Long Island--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various shots -- the massive house; the glistening pool; waterfall; fountains; tennis court; driving range; gazebo; gym; sauna; library; media room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the most expensive real estate in the world, with maids, cooks, landscapers, you name it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 115L       WE SEE the household STAFF lined up outside th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We even had two guards who worked in shifts, both named Rocco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street     Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amid billowing piles of white Chinese silk, Jordan sleeps on his back, snoring blissfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It   was heaven on earth. On screen WE SEE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Splash!   A glass of water hits him in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up, you bag of shit! Soaking wet, Jordan sits upright to see Naomi standing over him in a tiny pink chemise, holding an empty glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuck are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Venice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is she?! Some little hooker you fucked last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?    No!    Naomi! And as Naomi storms off for a re-fill...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan lies on the ground, hands tied with a lit candle up his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venice, where are you?                                * VENICE, A Blue Chip Hooker, enters, pulls out a candle and straddles him. She drips wax on his back and pulls his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to scene. Naomi holds another full glass, rocking back and forth on the balls of her feet like a fighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages    3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were calling her name in your sleep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can explain everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead. More lies from the man who lies for a living!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, really. Donnie and me, we're investing in a condo development in Venice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Italy?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: California, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duchess, come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't `Duchess' me, you scumbag. You think I don't know what you're up to? You're a father now and you act like an infant! Splash!   She nails him again, crosses for more water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck. Naomi!    Why are you so mad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you want me to start? How about you flying in here on your stupid helicopter at three in the morning waking up Skylar?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan crash-lands the helicopter on the driving range. He exits, gives Captain Dave a salute, fights his way through the bushes, then stumbles toward the house and falls into the pool, stoned out of his skull. Security floodlights come on and the alarm sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it even matter to you that I just had that driving range sodded with Bermuda grass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to scene.   Naomi holds another glass of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why should you give a shit? You're not the one who researched the fucking thing and dealt with the fucking golf course people!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an aspiring landscape architect?! But what happened to wine connoisseur? Oh wait, that was last month!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you! Naomi winds up with the water glass. Jordan stands tall, puffs himself up, arms flexed at his sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop flexing your arms, you look like a fucking imbecile. (re: his crotch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't think that impresses me much. Jordan looks down: he has a morning erection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't flexing my arms. You're just lucky to have a husband who's in such great shape. Now get over here and kiss me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss you?! Splash! She nails him one last time, then storms out. He stands there dripping wet. To his erection:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the fuck were you last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My morning ritual. First I'd get up and fight with Naomi about whatever I did the night before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan stands in the steaming shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next it was a steam so I could sweat out whatever drugs were still in my system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan looks at himself in the mirror.      His eyes are bloodshot - he looks like shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After that I'd assess the damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan looks at a Visine bottle - "Recommended Dosage - Two Drops". He squirts six drops in each eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of maniac abuses eye drops?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fully dressed and standing amid hundreds of suits, Jordan pops two white pills, swigs some juice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'd get dressed, take my "back pills" to get me started, then attempt to make up with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan enters the tiny pink wonderland. On the fluffy pink carpet is Naomi, now in a minidress hiked above her hips, Manolo Blahniks showing polished red toes. Between her legs sits SKYLAR, their 5-month-old daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Skylar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (little girl voice) Good morning Daddy. Where's my kiss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan kisses the baby, picks her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playing along) Does Daddy get to kiss both his girls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhh, no! Daddy doesn't even get to touch Mommy for a very, very long time. Naomi lays back on her elbows, thighs parted - she's wearing no panties. The wind goes out of Jordan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Nay, please. You know how sorry I am. I swear I--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) Daddy shouldn't waste his time. And from now on it's going to be nothing but short, short skirts around the house! And Mommy's so sick and tired of wearing panties, uhhh. In fact she's decided to throw them all away. (parting her thighs) So take a good look. You'll be seeing an awful lot of it around the house, but no touching. She licks her lips seductively.     Jordan sets Skylar aside, starts grovelling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, Daddy? Naomi slips her index finger in her mouth, starts sucking it. Jordan can barely speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, why are you doing this? I said I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pouting) Ohhhh poor, poor Dada. He loves to say how wrong he is when he's ready to come in his own pants. Isn't that right Dada? Mommy loves Daddy so, so much and there's nothing she wants to do more right now than to make love to Daddy all day long. Well, I guess it's time for Daddy to be taught his first lesson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages     3/5/13 Naomi runs her fingers over her stomach and on to her inner thigh, then up toward her vagina. Jordan watches transfixed, then a change comes over him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't do that if I were you Mommy. I think Mommy should hear a story before she decides to please herself like that. Can Daddy tell Mommy a story? (off her nod)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And does mommy promise to keep her legs spread wide, wide open the whole time? (she nods dreamily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Once upon a time there was a great big mansion in Long Island and the people who lived there had lots and lots of money. But of all the possessions they had, there was one thing that was much more valuable than all the rest combined, and that was their little baby daughter. Naomi listens, legs still spread, hand on her crotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now because he was very security- conscious, the Daddy hired two full-time guards, big hairy men both named Rocco, and they installed security cameras all around the house. And one of those cameras is right over Daddy's shoulder. Naomi's eyes widen -- she look toward a Teddy Bear on a shelf. WE SEE that one of the eyes is a pinhole camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So smile, Mommy! You're on Candid Camera!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mesmerized, ROCCO DAY watches a video screen, on which we see a grainy image of Naomi, hand between her legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naomi jumps up as if she's been electrocuted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street    Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13 As she bolts from the room, Jordan plays with Skylar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The good thing about living with a world-class ballbreaker is they make all the other ballbreakers in your life a little easier to take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie stands talking with Jordan's assistant, Janet. Jordan approaches under a head of steam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a quick hug; then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve here yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On his way.     Very excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.   Cuz we have a problem. He indicates out to the Bullpen.      Donnie and Janet lo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he wearing a bow tie? In the Bullpen WE SEE a young Stratton Broker in a bowtie cleaning a small goldfish bowl on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got nothing better to do on the day of the biggest IPO in this firm's history?! Jordan watches as Donnie marches toward the Broker in a bowtie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuck you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bewildered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cleaning my fishbowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13 Donnie nods, turns to go, but suddenly he turns back and thrusts his arm in the bowl, grabbing for the squirming goldfish. The Broker in a bowtie looks on, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On new issue day?! On cocksucking, motherfucking new issue day?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dozen of Brokers and Sales Assistants look over as Donnie snatches up the fish. Holding it by its tail, he jumps up on the desk of the Broker in a bowtie. Now the entire Bullpen looks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what happens when you fuck with your pets on new issue day!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the flair of a showman, Donnie pops the fish in his mouth, swallowing it whole. The Brokers cheer wildly. Donnie jumps down, gets in the face of the Broker in a bowtie:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now take your bowtie, get your shit and get the fuck out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bowtie is stunned. And as Donnie storms off, we PUSH IN on Jordan, watching from across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan finishes a phone call as Donnie enters with STEVE MADDEN, 30s, dressed in wrinkled navy blazer, cargo pants and T-shirt, a baseball cap over his scraggly, thinning hair. Jordan smiles, crosses to greet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cobbler.    Ready to get rich?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as they ad lib greetings, settle in at the couch:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve Madden, the shoe designer, was a childhood friend of Donnie's, but I didn't hold that against him. Remember those ads, those giant-headed girls with bug eyes wearing those big clunky shoes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 127A   INSERT - a quick series of Steve Madden ads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages    3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He came to me a few years earlier when he was just starting out, so I became a silent partner in his company, buying an 85% stake for only a million bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE various stores, all packed with teenage GIRLS buying shoes and boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The company blew up and we were now taking it public. It was the biggest deal we'd ever done and the hottest IPO on Wall Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan and Donnie sit with Steve Madden in mid- conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --which is why they need to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta get `em fired up so they'll push the shit out of this stock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let them feel your passion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bustling with activity. With Jordan and Donnie looking on from nearby, Steve Madden approaches a microphone on the raised platform, in his hands several shoe boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhhh... excuse me... The place slowly comes to order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For those of you who don't know me, my name is Steve Madden. I'm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know who you are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street    Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13 Steve clears his throat, looks over at Jordan -- he's terrified. Jordan motions for him to calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I uh, I'd like to start by telling you about my background in the shoe industry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice fucking hat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I uh... first started working in the shoe industry, in a shoe store. When I was sixteen, my friends were out chasing girls, but I was learning about women's shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move the mike closer.             We can't fucking hear y He moves the mic; feedback SCREECHES through the bullpen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry... Anyway, my first job was at a shoe store like I said where I worked in the stockroom. You know, I can honestly say I've been a lover of women's shoes since I was twelve--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freak!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Heh-heh. Not like that. I mean somehow I became fascinated with the endless design possibilities for women's shoes--

dialogues.speaker: BROKER
dialogues.text: Queer!                            Get a fucking life! Boos, hisses. Steve looks at Jordan, who motions for him to speed up. He grabs a shoe from one of the boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This shoe --    the Mary Lou -- is the one that    really put me on the map. It's a     black patent leather variation of    the Mary Jane, but-- SPLAT! A half-eaten grapefruit lands at Steve's feet. In a flash, Jordan rushes over, grabs the mic--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street    Buff Revised Pages    3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, let's hear it for Steve Madden and the wonderful Mary Lou! Huge applause, with stomping feet; howling, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, now that you got that out of your system, I want you to know why Steve is so completely off the fucking wall... It's because this man is a creative genius. Steve's power, his gift -- is that he creates trends. Artists like Steve come along once a century! Elvis! Andy Warhol!    Giorgio Armani! Who knows how high this stock could go? The 20s? The 50s? The 80s? Applause; war whoops.      Jordan motions for quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want everybody to look down. See that little black box in front of you? It's called a telephone. Now I'm gonna let you in on a little secret about this telephone -- it won't dial itself! That's right -- until you take some action, it's nothing more than a worthless hunk of plastic, like a loaded M16 without a trained Marine to pull the trigger. And in the case of the telephone, it's the action of you, a highly trained Strattonite, a killer who will not take no for an answer!   A person who will not hang up the phone until his client either buys or fucking dies! The Brokers go crazy.      Jordan looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care if you graduated from Harvard or Bumfuck University or never got past fourth fucking grade! That phone is the great equalizer! (pause; looks around) There is no nobility in poverty. I've been rich, and I've been poor and I choose rich every time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least as a rich man, when I have to face my problems, I show up in the back of a limo wearing a $2000 suit and $40,000 gold watch! Jordan takes off his GOLD WATCH, flings it to the Crowd. Brokers go nuts, fighting over it like a home-run ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if anyone here thinks I'm crazy, get the fuck out and get a job at McDonald's, because that's where you fucking belong! But before you depart this room full of winners, I want you to take a good look at the person next to you, because one day in the not-so- distant future, you'll be sitting at a red light in your beat-up old Pinto, and that person's gonna pull up in a brand new Porsche, with their gorgeous young wife at their side. And who will you be next to? Some ugly beast with three days of razor-stubble in a sleeveless moo-moo, crammed in next to you with a carload of groceries from the fucking Price Club! He scans the Brokers; they're on the edge of their seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
