dialogues.text: So you listen to me and listen carefully. Are you behind on your credit card bills? Good. Pick up the phone and start dialing. Is your landlord threatening to evict you? Good. Pick up the phone and start dialing. Does your girlfriend think you're a fucking loser? Pick up the phone and start fucking dialing! I want you to deal with your problems by becoming rich! I want you to go out and spend money! Leverage yourself, back yourself into a corner, let the consequences of failure become so fucking unthinkable that you'll have no choice but to do whatever it takes to win! The Brokers go absolutely APESHIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have an obligation here, people! To your clients! To this firm! An obligation to yourself, godammit! You ram Steve Madden stock down your clients' throats and make them choke on it till they buy 20,000 shares! Be aggressive! Be ferocious! Be telephone fucking terrorists!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Jordan is even finished, the Brokers GO BERSERK, some already dialing their phones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At 1 p.m. we opened the stock for sale at $4.50 a share. By 1:03 it was over eighteen dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Denham exits the elevator, arriving for work. He strides between cubicles, briefcase in hand. He enters --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- where pinned up on one wall is a massive chart on Stratton's operations: pictures of Jordan, Donnie and others, a hierarchy, a history, an investigation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Total sales frenzy. The CAMERA PANS the 300 Brokers, who work the phones like mad.

dialogues.speaker: SEA OTTER YOUNG BROKER
dialogues.text: --the hottest new issue on       --up two dollars while I Wall Street!                     talking to you! And as we continue PANNING the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I couldn't have done this without help. I'd leaked the word on Wall Street that Stratton was a buyer up until twenty. So not only were we pushing Madden, all the big firms were too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We continue PANNING the frenzied Brokers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages    3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as they knew I'd buy the shares back at the top of the market, they'd drive the price up as high as I fucking wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie pours champagne nearby, oblivious to Jordan, who sits at his desk, speaking directly to camera:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of the two million shares being offered for sale, a million belonged to me, held in phony accounts by my ratholes. Once the price hit the high teens, I-- Jordan abruptly stops.     A beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said before, who gives a shit? As always, the point is this-- BACK TO SCENE -- Donnie hands Jordan a glass of Dom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 22 million in three fucking hours! They toast, then each pop ludes, which they wash down with champagne. A quick knock; Janet pops her head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janet, baby.    Drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call for you.    Barry Kleinman from Future Video?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He filmed your wedding.     He says it's urgent. Curious, Jordan leans over, hits the speaker phone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barry Kleinman sits at his desk, talking on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan, hey. Listen, I got a subpoena. The FBI wants a copy of your wedding video.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Jordan.    Uh-oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The F-B-fucking-I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing goggles and protective headphones, square-jawed FBI Agent Patrick Denham takes target practice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name's Denham, he's an agent in the New York office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's his problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a boy scout, thinks you're Gordon Gekko.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The East Harlem institution. Jordan sits across a table over pasta with private investigator BO DIETL, 40s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But my goddamn wedding video?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got your whole inner circle in one place, faces and names. He's hoping it rattles you, or maybe your wife, so that she starts nagging you to turn witness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (that's laughable) What? He wants me to rat on myself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Good news is I made some calls, DEA, Justice? No one but him even knows who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you bug him or something, tap his phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan, relax. First off, you don't fuck with these guys, not that way. Secondly, I got a P.I. license, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I should call him, see what he wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Anybody does that should be your lawyer. What you do is eat your dinner, drink your drink, and forget about it. Cuz as far as I hear he doesn't have shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan nods, wheels turning, pretending to do as told.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Agent Denham steps into frame, another FED, AGENT HUGHES, beside him, both G-man stoic in impenetrably dark glasses --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick? Hey! C'mon aboard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look up. On the yacht Naomi, Jordan stands waving, drinking wine with two Blue Chip HOOKERS in bikinis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plank's right down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denham shares a look with his cohort: it's almost a joke, this display of wealth before a federal agent. Moments later, they step aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Belfort, I'm Agent Denham. This is Agent Hughes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heya! This is Nicole and, um...Heidi. Girls, Patrick and...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agents Denham and Hughes. Your message said you wanted to speak privately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It did. I do. (off Denham's stare) Oh, they're just friends. (to the girls) Give us a minute, okay? The Hookers head below deck. Jordan shoots Denham a wink- check out that ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get a glass? Got wine open or any kinda booze. Shrimp and lobster're over there if you're hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bureau forbids us from drinking at sea. Jordan surprised: the guy has a sense of humor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have something for you, I just gotta find it. Have a seat, will ya? Ever been on one of these before? As Jordan rifles through some papers, Denham's eyes scan the deck, casually cataloguing everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boat? Learned to sail when I was six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, one like this. Just had her extended to put a chopper on the back. Jordan points out the Bell-Jet helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never been on a boat with a second mode of transportation on top of it. Jordan finds the file he's been looking for, offers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (before he'll accept) What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Names and addresses of every guest at my wedding. Friends, clients. I even threw in the seating chart. Heard that's why you wanted the video, figured this'd expedite whatever it is you're doing. (Denham looks: it's indeed a guest list from the wedding) I wanted to show you I've got nothing to hide. I know you're investigating Stratton but for the life of me I can't figure out why. Sure, my company is unorthodox; what brokerage isn't? Maybe we're a little louder than most but we don't do anything illegal. Talk to the SEC, they'll tell you, they checked us out up and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SEC's actually a civil regulatory agency. We pursue criminal activity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm saying. You guys take on real crime. Which is why I'm so curious: what do you think we did? The reason Jordan asked him here, Denham realizes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't discuss ongoing investigations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Though, to be frank, this case kinda got dumped on my desk. Some higher-up felt your shop needed looking into after all that press, fell on me to do the looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know who you should be looking at? Goldman, Lehman Brothers, Merrill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What those guys're up to with collateralized debt obligations? This internet stock bullshit? C'mon. If you want, I'll walk you through exactly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- that'd be great. And if there's anything you can give me just to close out your file, get it off my desk--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- sure, get you back to the real criminals --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- then we could both profit from this little sit-down. Jordan sizes him up: what did Denham mean by "profit"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you don't want anything to drink? Water for your pal? (Denham demurs) Rumor is your started out in finance. Even got your broker's license before you joined the bureau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who told you that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (searches his memory) Jeez, who was it...? (comes up short) Ever regret it? Giving up the money-crazed, pin-striped life? Ever think where you'd be if you'd stuck with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I'm riding the subway home, sweating my balls off, in a suit I've worn three days, sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whattaya pull in working at the bureau, if you don't mind me asking. 50-60K a year?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just about. We get a free handgun out of it, though, that doesn't suck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S'crazy, the world we live in, the jobs with real value, the ones we should appreciate -- firefighters, teachers, FBI agents -- those are the ones we pay the least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's one thing I like about what I do, the opportunity to make that right. Take this kid we had interning last year. Didn't want to be a broker, wanted to be an environmental scientist or something, he had a student loan debts up to his eyeballs. Anyway, his mom gets sick, all they can afford is third-rate care. Some of us got together, made an investment on his behalf and -- boom -- overnight everything changes, she's seeing the best doctors in the country. Sadly, didn't work out, she passed but still: having the power to do that makes all the other bullshit worth while. (as Denham considers that)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, it's all about proper guidance, Pat. Knowing someone with the right relationships, who's discreet. I can change a life almost every day. They measure each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much that intern make off your deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: North of half a million. Denham summons Agent Hughes over. To Jordan:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you say that again, what you told me? (Jordan declines with a smile; to Agent Hughes) I believe Mr. Belfort just tried to bribe a federal officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I was making conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like that to me, Jordan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...no, no, no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...sounded like that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...no, to constitute a bribe, don't I have to make an explicit offer of money for services? With an exact dollar figure attached? All I said was "north" of half a million. According to the U.S. Criminal Code, that dog won't hunt, Pat. (then) Heard you were a straight arrow. That you wouldn't bend the rules other agents might. He was right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did a background check on me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figured you were looking into me, was only fair. Plus you sail on a yacht fit for a Bond villain, sometimes you gotta act the part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is why you invited me down to your yacht? With a couple hookers on it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- those are friends --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- to get a sense of the guy who was coming after you? Jordan puts his hands up: "you got me."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for coming down. Now get off my boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, most of the Wall Street jackasses I bust, they were born to the life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages    3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their father was a douchebag before them, and his father before that. But you, you got this way all on your own. Good for you, Jordan. (as he starts to go)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for having us. I'm absolutely certain we'll see each other again. (before he does)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, this is about the nicest boat I've ever been on. Just think what a hero I'll be in the office when the bureau seizes it. Jordan watches him go, temper flaring: he can't let Denham get the final word. He calls after them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Denham! I'm gonna eat a claw of lobster now as I get my cock sucked by Heidi down below. You have a super ride home on the subway thinking about that!                          * As he watches them pull away, seething --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a numbers guy, a follow-the- fucking-money'er. He wasn't gonna come at me through my guys, looking for a weak link and a quick kill. He was gonna come at me like an accountant would, the way Ness got Capone, through my books. Which meant? It was ass- covering time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Naomi looks on, 5 months pregnant, Jordan packs a suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Switzerland?    What the fuck is in Switzerland?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swiss cheese, Naomi, what do you fucking think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUMMER `95)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan sits talking with Rugrat and Donnie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rugrat set up a meeting with a Swiss Banker he knew from law school who could launder our money, but it wasn't till noon the next day. Jordan glances at his watch, washes down a few ludes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew if I timed my lude intake right, I'd sleep through the entire overnight flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan stands before the Bullpen talking to his Brokers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At four p.m. I popped a few ludes, which started kicking in by the time I finished our sales meeting. This was the tingle phase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over dinner, a visibly high Jordan ravenously digs into his food as Donnie and four Blue Chip Hookers look on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By dinner I popped a few more on top of some cocktails and an valium or two. The slur phase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the crowded dance floor, Jordan gets knocked around like a marionette, saliva strung from his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By eight thirty I'd done a few more and pretty much lost my motor skills. This was the drool phase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan is barely conscious as a Hooker rides him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And by ten I didn't know who or what I was doing -- the amnesia phase. We boarded the plane just before midnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan boards, slurring, drooling, completely wasted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to a Stewardess)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetheart! Look at you! And as he hugs her, then stumbles toward his seat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet; morning sunlight bleeds through the window. Jordan's eyes flicker open. He yawns, looks around, tries to get up; he can't move. He looks down, sees six seat belts restraining his arms and legs. Jordan looks over at Donnie, mouth agape, asleep next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie.   Donnie, wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nuuhh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Untie me, shitbag. You think this is funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't tie you, the captain did. He almost tasered you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK --
dialogues.text: As PASSENGERS scream, Jordan wildly humps a STEWARDESS, the CAPTAIN struggling to restrain him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was fucking great. I hadn't laundered a dime yet and already I was under arrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pensive Jordan sits, mind racing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worse yet was the plastic baggie of ludes that Donnie'd stuffed up his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13 Jordan trades looks with Donnie, who shifts uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But before he could even get a hemorrhoid--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan sits with two CUSTOMS OFFICERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the whole thing was quashed by                    * our friend the Swiss banker. Which                  * was lucky for me, since so far I'd                  * been able to keep Agent Fuckface                    * unaware of the trip.                                *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another CUSTOMS OFFICER enters, whispers something to the others. They shake Jordan's hand and he leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A limo pulls up at an office building.      Jordan emerge with Rugrat and Donnie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEAN-JACQUES SAUREL greets them. 30s, suave. The lobby is ultra-modernist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan Belfort! At last! Nicholas has told me so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan, Jean-Jacques Saurel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to make your acquaintance. This is some lobby you got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, yes. We gave our designer an unlimited budget and he exceeded it. Come! You must tell me all about your adventure with the stewardess over coffee!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They disappear upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street     Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan, Rugrat and Donnie drink coffee with Saurel and one other SWISS BANKER. It's an impressive office, with an enormous fish tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a joke in America. "Heaven is a place where the police are Brits, the chefs are Italian, the car mechanics are German, the prostitutes are French and the bankers are Swiss." I never got it `til now -- look at those fucking fish! Come here, little guy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we have the same joke here. Only sometimes the English are chauffeurs and the chefs are French. The Germans, alas, are always mechanics; no one wants to grant them more authority than that. Polite laughter. Jordan, not as impressed by the fish, cuts straight to the point:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm curious about your bank secrecy laws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excusez-moi, Jordan, Swiss custom requires ten minutes of idle chit- chat before business can be discussed. (a smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, let's get "down to it." What would you like to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under what circumstances would you be obligated to cooperate with an FBI or U.S. Justice Department investigation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ca depend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ca depend?      Ca depend on what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street    Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whether America plans to invade Switzerland in the coming months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want me to see if tanks are rolling down the Rue de la Croix? More chuckles.   Through Jordan's forced smile:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I'm asking, you Swiss dick, is are you going to fuck me over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand perfectly, you American shitheel. Saurel smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only way the Banque Real de Geneve would cooperate with a foreign legal body is if the crime being pursued also happened to be a crime in Switzerland. But there are very few Swiss laws pertaining to your "rumored" improprieties. Which is why Mr. Azoff's joke is most appropriate: from a financial standpoint you are now in heaven, and we welcome you. If the U.S. Justice Department or FBI or SEC or IRS sent us a subpoena, it would become papier-toillette. We would wipe our ass with it. Everyone's impressed.      Except Jordan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless it was an investigation into stock fraud -- which is a crime in Switzerland. Then you'd have to cooperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (now he's impressed) Yes, we would. Assuming the account is under your name. However, if it were in the name of a nominee of yours... They take each other in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street     Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that yodeling I just heard or did you just say what I thought you said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!   Yes! As the meeting wraps up with handshakes, Jordan's V.O. overwhelms Saurel's V.O..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was telling me to use a rathole. Problem was: sneaking a U.S. rathole into Switzerland was a chance I couldn't take. What I needed was somebody with a European passport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naomi's Aunt Emma answers the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (big smile, sweating)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amid towering trees and horse trails, a noticeably twitchy Jordan walks arm-in-arm with Aunt Emma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell me about this plan of yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like us to go to Switzerland tomorrow so you can open an account. I'll fund it, and I'll pay you really well for your trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages    3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next month maybe you can fly to New York and we can start moving the cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving the cash. (smiles) I feel like a character in an Ian Fleming novel. It's all quite racy, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is, and it's illegal too. Of course if you ever got in trouble, I'd come forward in two seconds, say I duped you, but even still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Risk is what keeps us young, isn't it darling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like that attitude. Promise me                      * you'll spend at least ten thousand pounds per month out of the account, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckles) I wouldn't even know how. I really do have everything I need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I bet you don't have everything you want. How about a bigger apartment so your grandkids can sleep over? Aunt Emma notices that Jordan is sweating, fidgety. jonesing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we sit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, that'd be great. They sit on a nearby bench.     After a while:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I wonder if you let money get the best of you, dear. (beat) Among other substances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street     Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's that obvious, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the height of summer and                         * you've got the chills.                                *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a drug addict, Emma. Coke,                        * pills, you name it, whatever you                      * got. Sex addict too.                                  *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Well there are worse things to be addicted to than sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckles; then) Why did I just tell you that?                         *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playful) Because I'm very easy to talk to. Jordan looks at her.       A few beats, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact you are. My                       * job, you know, it's tough. I mean                     * I'm not complaining, it's just the stress. All these people depending                    * on me. Millions of dollars at                         * stake every day. I sometimes feel                     * I've bitten off more than I can                       * chew.                                                 *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a man with large appetites. Jordan looks at her and smiles:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she fucking hitting on me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree. I put it on myself. It's                     * hard to control the anxiety, you                      * know? It's hard to learn to relax.                    *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To release the tension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is hitting on me! Holy shit! Jordan leans in closer, casually slips an arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly, to release the tension.                    * Sometimes you gotta learn to do                     * what comes natural in life, huh?                    *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Emma pulls back slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he fucking hitting on me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans in even closer, kisses her, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stability, dear. Family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take care of my niece, my love. And I'll take care of everything over here.                               * (a beat)                                       * Ah, once upon a time...                             *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUMMER `95)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan fucks Naomi.    There's a curious thunk-thunk-thun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I got home, I realized there was no way Aunt Emma could smuggle that much cash by herself. I racked my brain for another person with a foreign passport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bed's covered with bundles of cash. Every thrust of Jordan's, another bundle plummets to the floor -- thunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUMMER `95)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With $20 mil in CASH on the bed, Jordan and a stoned Donnie watch as Brad tapes stacks of cash to his wife CHANTALLE, a bombshell in panties, bra and sneakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bra-had, theese tape eez focking steeky!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Brad keeps taping her up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a successful drug dealer, Brad spent his winters in the South of France, which is where he met his wife Chantalle, a stripper of Slovenian origin but born in, of all places, Switzerland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take eet off, Bra-had! Eet erts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You beetch, you focking douche-a- bag-a! Donnie can't help but start laughing at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take eet off!    Take eet off! Brad seethes at this but keeps taping...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUMMER `95)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chantalle is completely taped up, a cash-covered mummy. Jordan looks on with Brad, Donnie and now Naomi. 90% of the cash is still on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this is fucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna take her like fifty trips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get her parents to tape up too. They got Swiss passports. Plus her brother and his wife. Five people, six-seven trips?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much'll they want for it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno, not much. Fuck, they'd probably do it just for the miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about my money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My money. I got a few mil of my own I wanna move. I'll call you, you can come pick it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes offense to Donnie's presumption) You'll "call" me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (what part don't you understand?) And you can come "pick it up." Brad asks Jordan if they can speak in private. MOMENTS LATER, IN PRIVATE: Jordan joins Brad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make me deal with this fucknut, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie?   He's just high is all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno if he's stupid or a junkie but he's a loose fuckin' cannon. I don't trust him and I don't want him around me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. I thought he was your best customer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only sell to him cuz he's your friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you just do one trip for him? Brad stews.   It's asking a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll meet him but I won't pick up. I have a limit of how much of that douchebag I can take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can hear you, motherfucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie emerges from where he's been eavesdropping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a douchebag?!! Well, whose fucking idea was it made us all this money?!! Who fucking knew Steve Madden?!! This douchebag!! So go fuck yourself a little!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad slaps Donnie so hard across the face he goes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next day, Aunt Emma flew to Geneva, two million in cash in her carry-on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wheeling a small carry-on suitcase, Aunt Emma smiles at a CUSTOMS AGENT, who waves her through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which in the big picture was a drop in the Swiss bucket --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 160aA   On another day, Chantalle and her family (PARENTS BROTHER, his WIFE) pass through Customs, "on vacation."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- because the following month, over the course of six round- trips, Chantalle and her family smuggled in over twenty million without even a hiccup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUMMER `95)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a cash-filled suitcase on the table, Chantalle remembers a last fold of cash hidden inside her skirt's lining. She laughs with Saurel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street     Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LATE SUMMER `95)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad waits by his Range Rover as Donnie's Rolls careens into the lot. He emerges, briefcase in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fu Manchu!      Kung fu!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie starts doing spastic karate moves. Is he high? Sure looks like it. Brad looks pissed, and Donnie starts laughing. Actually he's dead sober.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just fucking with you, man. Jesus, the look on your face. (Brad isn't laughing) Hey, sorry if I got outta line the other day, I was just, that was the drugs talking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S'cool, just... gimme the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he doesn't) You know, I always kinda regretted you didn't come to work with us at Stratton. It'd be so cool having you around, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (growing impatient) Yeah, well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd be one of us, we'd go out- partying together, you wouldn't have to dress like a mall rat guinea prison bitch all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie grins, obviously still smarting from Brad's slap. Brad just wants to take the money and be done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DISTANCE AWAY, a COP in a patrol car notices Brad gesturing to Donnie for his briefcase. He nudges his partner: check this out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I come over and help tape this to your wife? "Eez so focking steeky! Take eet off, Bra-hod!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad composes himself, lest he kill the guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna give you a pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna give you a pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna give me a pass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.    Just gimme the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna give me a pass? Okay... (offers the case) Why don't you stick your pass up your Slavic cunt's pussy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That does it. Brad attacks. Donnie throws the case at him, which opens on impact, money spilling out. Brad instinctively tries to contain it... and that's when the POLICE SIRENS start. Here comes the patrol car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie bolts. With no time to get to his car, Brad takes off on foot, bleeding briefcase in hand, toward a video store where he stashes his .38 in the return box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze!   Don't move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad drops to his knees, briefcase at his feet. From a distance, Donnie peers around a corner to watch him get arrested, knowing he fucked this up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LATE SUMMER `95)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie is seated at his desk, freaking out and trying to figure out what to do. He exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LATE SUMMER `95)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a flourish, Donnie presents a bottle full of ludes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jord, do I have a surprise for                      * you. Twenty real lemons! A retired                  * pharmacist friend of mine's been                    * sitting on these the last 15                        * years.                                              *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking serious?! CLOSE ON -- a Lemmon 714 Quaalude; pure white, with trademark ridged edges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lemmon 714 was the Holy Grail of Quaaludes, outlawed since the `80s and three times as powerful as anything available today. For a Quaalude addict, it was like finding a 1952 Chateau Margaux. CLOSE ON -- Donnie gauging Jordan's excitement, waiting for the right moment to admit his fuck-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd been saving these for a special occasion, like a birthday or celebrating our money being out of the country. Instead I thought I'd better use `em to help break the news about Brad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LATE SUMMER `95)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his underwear, Jordan kneels over the toilet, sticking his fingers down his throat to make himself vomit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That night I cleared my schedule and rid my body of anything that could fuck with my high. It was celebration time. He takes a box off the counter marked "Active Enema". He squats and administers it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Massive, with a wet bar, media center and full gym. Giddy as kids on Christmas, Jordan and Donnie sit on the couch, the bottle of Lemmons before them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start with one, see how it goes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages      3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My guy says one's all we'll need. Salut'. Excited, they each pop a lude, toast with hot sake'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bored, Jordan and Donnie sit on the couch watching "Family Matters" on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You feeling anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. (glances at watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we've built up a tolerance all these years? Donnie shrugs; they pop another, wash it down with sake'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Jordan running on the treadmill, Donnie pumps away on an exercise bike nearby. They're both sweating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is bullshit, man. My fucking metabolism's pumping and I don't feel shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're old, maybe they lost their potency. Donnie leans over, picks up the bottle.         Reads the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: January `81.    They're fucking duds. He shakes out more pills, two more apiece. As they pop them, a very pregnant Naomi descends the stairs, now very pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you two retards doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.   Working out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a look; then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Dietl's on the phone. Naomi heads back upstairs.    Jordan picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo, hey, what's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Dietl talks on his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to talk to you, but not on this phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, what's--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave the house, call me back from a pay phone, you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan pulls his Lamborghini out of the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Brookville Country Club was a WASP stronghold, a straight shot down the road from my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan pulls up, exits the car in sweats, flip-flops and a T-shirt. He hustles up a staircase into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan stands at a pay phone, receiver to his ear. WE HEAR it ringing, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street     Buff Revised Pages     3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm at a pay phone.       What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo talks on his cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your buddy Brad's in jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus Christ! What did he do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno yet, they arrested him in a shopping mall in Long Island this morning, I'm finding out. But listen to me. More important than that. The guy Denham I told you about, the Fed? He's got your phones tapped, I'm pretty sure. Home and office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie, that piece of shit. I'm gonna kill him! That fat prick mother fucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, listen to me. Do me a favor, please do not talk on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you try to bribe this fuckin' guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No!       I didn't try to bribe anybody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan? I couldn't understand you. Say that again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I zay I zint ty zoo bibe azybuzzy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you fucking high?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13 Jordan can't respond. Phone still to his ear, his eyelids droop. Drool spills from his slackened jaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After fifteen years in storage, the Lemmons had developed a delayed fuse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JORDAN'S POV -- is hazy as he stares at his own reflection in the pay phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It took 90 minutes for the little fuckers to kick in, but once they did -- pow! I had skipped the tingle phase and went straight to the drool phase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JORDAN'S POV -- the phone gets further and further away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually I'd discovered a new phase: the cerebral palsy phase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAMMM!! Jordan hits the floor with a thud, crashed out on his back. From the dangling phone, we hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over phone) Jordan! Jordan! Do not get behind the wheel! Just tell me where you're at, I'll send Rocco!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan lolls his head toward the phone, tries to reach for it; he can't. He lays there for a while, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, stand up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rolls onto all fours, lifts a hand, topples over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, walking is off the list of options. All right, what else is there? (a brainstorm) I can crawl, like Skylar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, Jordan begins crawling like an infant to the top of the staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street     Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lamborghini is parked at the bottom, twenty steps down. He starts to crawl down the stairs, stops. Tries again. Can't figure out how to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck!   The kid makes it look so easy! An icy wind blows through his T-shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think, you motherfucker, think! (a few beats; then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, I've got it! Jordan slowly curls himself into a ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can roll! Forcing himself over the edge, Jordan begins to descend the steps, one at a time. Thump. Thump. Then faster. Thump- Thump-Thump. Faster still. He loses control, takes all the steps at once. Thump-Thump-Thump-Thump- Thump-Thump. He lands with a crash on the asphalt, drags himself up and into the Lamborghini.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ignition on, Jordan sits hunched over, chin resting on the steering wheel. Just then, the car phone RINGS. With great effort, he pushes the speaker phone button:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...ello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Omigod!    Jordan, where are you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whazz a marra?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Donnie, he's totally out of control! He's on the other line with some Swiss guy! Jordan's face reads horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whaa?!!    No!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't understand you! Just get home, hurry! Naomi clicks off.    And as Jordan puts the car in gear..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say God protects drunks and babies. I was praying the same held true for drug addicts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peering over the wheel like an old lady, Jordan slowly maneuvers the Lamborghini down the dark road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was less than a mile from home and drove slower than shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan pulls up in the Lamborghini, shuts the ignition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somehow I made it alive, not a scratch on me or the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON the TV, where a POPEYE cartoon is playing. PULL BACK to reveal Skylar watching. As Jordan staggers in, Naomi approaches...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Zonnie?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phone to his ear and at least as stoned as Jordan, Donnie stands at the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --zee money, I wazza move izz to Zwizzyland...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street    Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LATE SUMMER `95)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having been just woken up, Jean-Jacques Saurel sits up in bed, phone to his ear, a perplexed look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What language are you speaking, Mr. Azoff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LATE SUMMER `95)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Naomi looking on, Jordan staggers toward Donnie like a drunk Frankenstein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ge ozza zone!     Ge ozza iz!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waz?   Iz zoggin oo anzali!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GE OZZA ZONE!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all the strength he can muster, Jordan RIPS the phone from the wall, throwing it skittering across the floor with a CLANG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wazza fuh is wrong wizzz oooo?!! I wuzz awwing to!! (Jordan grabs him) Wazza mazzer?! Wazza yoo razy?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skylar looks on from the next room, crying as Jordan tries to shake some sense into Donnie. Naomi crosses to Skylar and rushes her out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zee vone!! He nah zuppose zoo dalk on zee vone!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wuzz?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZE NAH ZUPPOSE ZOO DALK ON ZEE VONE!! WUZZ AAZZEN TOZAY WIZ ZOD?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WUZZ?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: WUZZ
dialogues.text: Fuck it. Jordan releases Donnie. Donnie crawls into the dining room and starts shoving ham into his mouth in an effort to sober up. Just then, we HEAR a horrible GAGGING sound. Donnie holds his throat as he falls backward choking, taking out the entire glass kitchen table with a tremendous CRASH! Naomi rushes back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Omigod, he's choking!     Jordan, do something!! Just then, WE HEAR the triumphant Popeye FANFARE -- Jordan looks to the TV, where POPEYE pours a can of spinach down his gullet. Instantly, his chest and arm muscles swell to five times their size. Jordan goes to get his coke. He snarfs up two fat spoonfuls and -- like that -- his chest swells and he takes a deep breath and he dashes back to the rescue... Jordan rushes back to Donnie, who is now blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not breathing! Jordan places his fingers over Donnie's artery.         N

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save him! Jordan kneels, starts furiously pumping Donnie's chest, breathing air into his lungs in rhythmic bursts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This stupid sonovabitch! All Donnie ever did was fuck me up and now I had to save his life `cause I took a CPR class when the baby was learning to swim. Just for the record, I want it noted: not for a second did I even think about letting him choke to death, even though it would've saved me an awful lot of headaches. Donnie still isn't breathing. Jordan flips him over, tries the Heimlich -- we hear a CRUNCH as he breaks Donnie's ribs. He flips him back over, but he's almost completely blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't come back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let him die! He has children!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One last try. Jordan takes a massive breath, blowing as hard as he can into Donnie's lungs. Donnie's stomach distends like a balloon, then suddenly a chunk of ham projects from his mouth and into Jordan's face. Donnie coughs, vomiting. And as he starts breathing again, Jordan exits and passes out on the living room couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan Belfort?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LATE SUMMER `95)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan opens his eyes. Through his HAZY POV, we see Violet, the maid standing over him with two OLD BROOKVILLE POLICE OFFICERS as Naomi attends to Donnie in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, we need to ask you some questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan exits the house with the Police Officers.        T Lamborghini is TOTALLED, an absolute wreck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Maybe I hadn't made it home okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASHBACK. Nodding out, Jordan drives the Lamborghini like a maniac, careening off parked cars and trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an absolute miracle I wasn't killed, and an even bigger miracle I hadn't killed anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street    Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN steps up to get his mug shot taken, but it's Brad, not Jordan. FLASH. Turn to the side. FLASH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they couldn't arrest me, the cops had no proof I'd been behind the wheel. Meanwhile, Brad did a                     * few months in jail for contempt                      * because he wouldn't rat Donnie out. They never found his gun, though, so they finally had to let him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan watches an INSTRUCTOR lead Skylar on a pony. Nearby Naomi holds newborn PARKER. Manny Riskin and Max stand beside Jordan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a lucky guy, Jordan. Legally I've never seen anyone slip a noose the way you do. Christ, you're lucky to be alive much less not in jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe in luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what all lucky people say. It's time, Jordan. Let me make a deal with SEC. Before your luck runs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skylar waves from the pony and Jordan waves back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of terms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You plead guilty to a handful of securities violations -- stock manipulation, high pressure sales tactics, ticky-tack shit like that. You pay a few million dollars in fines and in exchange the SEC fucks off for all time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Stratton?    What happens there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd have to walk away. Let Donnie take over. (that one hurts) Now the FBI's a different animal. They can still pursue you for criminal wrongdoing. But with you on the sidelines, my guess is your best friend Agent Denham'll be left standing around with his dick in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan digests that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You beat them, Jordan. You won. Sail into the sunset with your wife and kids while you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God knows you'll never have to work again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jordan looks at his picture-perfect family, WE HEAR THE ROAR OF A CROWD...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SPRING `96)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The troops ROAR as Jordan takes center stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure many of you have been hearing rumors lately, about me, about the future of this firm, and that's what I'd like to talk to you about today. (a few beats, then) Five years ago when I started Stratton with Donnie Azoff, I knew the day would eventually come when I'd be moving on. It's truly with a heavy heart that I tell you that day is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place erupts in a chorus of "No!", "Don't go!", etc. Jordan raises his hand for quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for that and for your years of incredible loyalty and admiration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The point is though, that under Donnie's leadership, along with Robbie Feinberg and Nicky Koskoff moving into key management positions, this place is gonna be better than ever! A smattering of applause. Jordan notices a few Brokers gravely shaking their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the fact that I'm gone won't stop me from giving Donnie advice, not that he needs any--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumping in) Why would anyone in their right mind not follow JB's advice? Donnie looks petrified; he's used to being an offensive tackle, not the quarterback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before I go, there's something I want to remind you all, and that's this -- Stratton Oakmont is bigger than any one person, even me. Especially me. You guys are Stratton, each and every one of you, and that is why it's sure to remain the best brokerage firm in the fucking world! Thunderous applause spreads through the boardroom, all 300 Brokers on their feet. WE PUSH IN on Jordan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, the very idea of Stratton is that when you come here and step into this bullpen for the first time, you start your life anew. You have a place here and no one can take that away from you! Stratton Oakmont is America! Give me your tired and poor! The very moment you walk through that door and pledge your loyalty to this firm, you become part of a family, you become a Strattonite! It doesn't matter who you are, it doesn't matter where you're from! Whether your family came over on the Mayflower or on a fucking inner tube from Haiti!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street    Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13 More applause. Jordan scans the young faces -- they worship him. In the crowd he finds KIMMIE BELZER, 30s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody here knows Kimmie Belzer, right? Hoots and hollers...      He raises his hand for quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In case any of you weren't aware of it, Kimmie was one of Stratton's first brokers, one of the original twenty. Now when most of you met Kimmie, you met her the way she is today -- a beautiful woman who drives a brand new Mercedes, a woman who lives in the finest condo complex on Long Island. A woman who wears $3000 Armani suits, who spends her winters in the Bahamas and her summers in the Hamptons! Wild applause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's not the Kimmie I met. The Kimmie I met was broke, a single mom on the balls of her ass. Three months behind on her rent with an eight year old son! She came to me for a job and when I hired her she asked for a $5000 dollar advance so she could pay his tuition. And what did I do, Kimmie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wrote me a check for $25,000!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I believed in you, like I believe in each and every one of you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Jordan! As the Brokers go berserk, Jordan stands basking in the adoration. He looks at Donnie, turns back to the Crowd, looks out at the faces. A change has come over him. He stands there, thinking. An eternity, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know for years I've been telling you guys not to take no for an answer, to keep pushing, to not hang up the phone till you get what you want. This deal I'm about to sign, barring me from the securities industry, barring me from Stratton, my home... What the fuck is that? I'll tell you what it is, it's me being a hypocrite. It's me taking no for an answer, it's them selling me, not the other way around! Fuck it, I'm not leaving!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan smiles, thrusts his hands in the air --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SHOW GOES ON!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place goes absolutely INSANE. And as Donnie and Max trade looks, TECHNO MUSIC BLASTS taking us to... 202Ea   EXT. YACHT NAOMI - AFT DECK - DAY (SPRING `96) It's celebration time. DOZENS of Strattonites party, drinking/dancing/snorting, Jordan at the center of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, the troops weren't the                    * only ones who were thrilled.                         *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Denham hears the news over the phone. A smile touches his lips: his case goes on... 202Fa   EXT. YACHT NAOMI - AFT DECK (SPRING `96)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party continues as Brad comes aboard.      He's welco and showered with lapdancers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I apologized to Brad and promised                    * him he'd never have to deal with                     * Donnie again. Even offered to pay                    * him for his time in the can. But                     * he said no, he was out. Sad thing                    * was, he was dead two years later.                    * Massive heart attack while sitting                   * on the john.                                         *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SPRING `96)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janet enters Jordan's office, leaves a stack of legal papers on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Within days, subpoenas started flying. They were burying me in paper --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 202Ha    INT. STRATTON OAKMONT III - BULLPEN - DAY (SPRIN Donnie pisses on a subpoena, to applause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- notices to produce documents, depositions. Donnie couldn't drink water fast enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Manny Riskin looks on, Jordan sits across from the three SEC Attorneys and a COURT REPORTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They interrogated everybody, it went on for months. It was total fucking harassment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various Stratton Brokers are deposed: Robbie; Rugrat, Peter DeBlasio, Sea Otter; Chester Ming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... but not a single Strattonite cracked. Donnie and I were given strict instructions not to leave the country...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...so we took our wives to Italy.                     * Each of us had a couple of million                    * we needed to deposit anyway --                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON A DUFFEL BAG FULL OF MONEY just resting on deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- this seemed the most civilized way to transport it overseas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON ANOTHER BAG, this one brimming with bottles of pills, bags of pot, vials of coke. Jordan and Donnie cut up lines as a HOSTESS serves Bloody Marys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get you anything else, gentlemen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a rare condition that requires me to drink one of these every fifteen minutes. If you could set your egg timer, I'd appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes. The blow is ready for inhaling. Jordan and Donnie are doing a "you first, no, you first" routine with a rolled up $100 when a CELL rings. Donnie grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rugrat! Bongiorno, my bald eagle!                   *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We may have a problem. Your                         * friend, Steve Madden, he's                          * unloading shares.                                   *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie reacts as Rugrat expounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!   You're fucking kidding?!                   *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I wish I was.                                   *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jordan)                                    * Rugrat says Steve Madden's                          * unloading shares.                                   *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! (Grabs Donnie's phone)                       * Rugrat, what the fuck?                              *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Hands Donnie his phone) Call the                   * sonovabitch! Hold on a second.                      * BACK AT STRATTON...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking at the screen and huge                  * chunks of Steve Madden are being                    * sold. We're not doing it so it's                    * gotta be Steve. He's the only                       * person who owns that many shares.                   * ON THE BOAT... Jordan cups the phone, looks to Donnie who shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not picking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your fucking friend is trying to fuck me. And you know where he's trying to fuck me? Up the ass. (back to Rugrat) I need some time to think.                          * Jordan thinks, snorts a line to think better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even though I owned 85% of Steve- Cocksucker-Madden-fucking-Shoes, the shares were in his fucking name. Motherfucker knew I was in trouble with the Feds and was trying to take advantage. He gets back on the phone with Rugrat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell all the brokers to sell.                       * Drive the price down. Steve will                    * go cockless when he watches me                      * turn his company into a penny                       * stock.                                              * (he hangs up) Sonovacunt! (yelling below deck) Captain Ted!! Start `er up, we gotta go home!                                      * The sight of Naomi and Hildy returning from their trip ashore stops him. Because Naomi's weeping, Hildy consoling her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck?! What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a call from cousin Betty. Aunt Emma's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Jordan's reaction as Naomi weeps and laments the dearly departed: "she was so young, so healthy" etc. --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking heart attack. Boom-snap, she was gone. Shuffled off her mortal coil and twenty million dollars in a Swiss bank account.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUMMER `96)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean-Jacques Saurel sits at his desk, calmly smoking as he talks on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is terrible. Your aunt was such an elegant, attractive woman. My condolences to you and your family. You must be --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (no time for it) Thanks but where does this leave us in regard to her account? It goes into probate or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to worry, Jordan. Your aunt, before she died, signed a document naming you as her successor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She did?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a sly grin) Well. Not as of yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as they continue talking, Jordan pulls out a nautical map of the Italian coastline:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta say, these Swiss were sneaky motherfuckers. Within minutes he made arrangements to set me up with a forger, the best document specialist in Geneva.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street    Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thing was: I had to get there in three business days to co-sign on the account. Jordan goes rapid-fire.     He yells:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Ted! Change of plan!                         * We're going to Monaco.                               *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monaco, now?                                         *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, babe. We're going to Monaco                     * so then we can go to Switzerland.                    *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But her aunt just died, we can't go to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I realize that but we have to go                     * to Switzerland.                                      *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about --                                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (way ahead of him) -- keep calling, when the fuck picks up, set a meet with him in three business days.                                 *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta go to London.                               *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The funeral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I loved your Aunt Emma more                   * than anyone in the world, but                        * she's still gonna be dead in two                     * days. She's not going anywhere.                      * Captain Ted Beecham emerges from below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Ted, we've gotta get to                      * Monaco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monaco?                                              *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street    Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we drive to Switzerland so                      * they don't stamp our passports.                      * Take care of business. Drive back                    * to Monaco, fly to London for the                     * funeral, fly back to New York to                     * be there in three business days -                    * That's the fuckin' plan.                             *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting reports of some weather out there. Might run into some chop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat's 170 feet long.      She can               * handle a little chop.                                *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going anywhere until he                    * says it's safe.                                      *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chop is fine.                                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it safe?                                          *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we take it slow...                                *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can do it?                                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chop is chop. Some chop - it can                     * be uncomfortable.                                    *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's fine.                                   *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything is possible. I mean we'll                   * have to batten down the hatches                      * just to be safe. Could be a few                      * broken dishes.                                       *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few broken dishes. Isn't that                      * great? Let's go to Monaco -                          * Jordan, Captain Ted and Donnie rush down stairs. As the ENGINE starts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street    Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The perfect storm. As the Naomi tips at a 45-degree angle, a thick wall of gray water comes rising over her side, slamming onto the bridge with a thunderous CRASH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well talk about your shitty vacations... Six Jet Skis plummet off the deck into the raging sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie and Naomi stand on the bridge where Captain Ted Beecham holds the ship's wheel with both hands, the radio blaring in the background. Jordan enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is going on?                           *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jet skis just went overboard.                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale warning!    Gale warning!                       *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waves are twenty feet and building!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you turn us around?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get broad-sided and tip over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale warning!    Gale warning! Naomi turns to Jordan, furious with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You happy now, you piece of shit?                    * We're gonna drown.                                   *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a master diver. We will not                      * drown, I promise you. I got you,                     * baby.                                                * (realizing she's                               * probably right; to Donnie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ludes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street    Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fucking ludes!                               *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're below deck! There's like three feet of water down there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't die fucking sober!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Donnie heads off --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is he crazy? Where's he                         * going? Donnie!                                       *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie retrieves the ludes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Ted stares through his binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ!                                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie returns with ludes - feeds to Jordan and then himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening?!                                   *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rogue wave!                                          *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan grabs Naomi. All at once the boat dips down at an impossibly steep angle, until it's pointing almost straight down. Captain Ted jams the throttle and the boat jerks forward, rising up the face of a giant rogue wave, which curls over the top of the bridge and... KABOOM! -- Blackness. Slowly, painfully, the boat pops up from beneath the water, its helicopter RIPPING from the deck and crashing into the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Mayday! This is Captain Ted Beecham aboard the Yacht Naomi! This is a Mayday!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are going down at the head fifty miles off the coast of Rome and we require immediate assistance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUMMER `96)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off to the side, Jordan watches as Naomi, their Friends, and the yacht's Crew Members dance to blaring techno music. A small group of Italian SAILORS cheer them on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nice thing about getting rescued by Italians is that the first thing they do is feed you and make you drink red wine. Then they make you dance. Jordan watches as the dancing continues, then casually glances out a porthole, where WE SEE the distant lights of a PLANE making its way across the night sky. After a few beats, the plane EXPLODES, a tiny flash of light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see that? That was the plane I sent for to come get us. I shit you not, it exploded when a seagull flew into the engine, three people killed. You want a sign from God, well after all this I finally got the message. I had to make some fucking changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan, looking healthier than we've seen him thus far, sits on the couch; stacks of paperwork on the coffee table. After a few beats, Naomi enters from the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner's ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta finish these balance sheets, babe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's there. So the kids are                      * gonna start.                                           *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naomi exits. Jordan goes back to work. Looks up at TV. Watches for a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the single most important                       * skill in life you can ever master?                     *

dialogues.speaker: 215A THE INFOMERCIAL.
dialogues.text: Shot on 90's-era video, an ad intended for late-night local tv. The defining idea here is that while the commercial may be amateurish, Jordan isn't; he's an excellent salesman even if the ad is cut-rate. WE START WITH FLASHES OF THE SEMINAR: Jordan in front of a dry erase board, lecturing a small audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
