dialogues.text: At the essence of every personal interaction, of every business transaction, of every effective human communication is PERSUASION... once you learn to control the linguistic encounter, you will be SHOCKED at what will happen... you are a person worth listening to, and taking it one step higher than that, you are someone who can help them achieve their goals...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 215B   JORDAN ON THE GROUNDS OF HIS ESTATE, addressing us

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you dream of being financially independent but struggle every month just to pay your bills? Would you like to own a home like                      * this one someday but can barely afford to pay your rent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Jordan Belfort and there's no secret to wealth creation. No matter who you are, where you came from, you too can                       * become financially independent in just a matter of months. All you need is a strategy. (NEW ANGLE; he enters from same side as previous shot)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first action you have to take is to DECIDE to be wealthy. When I was 24 years old, I made a DECISION not to just survive but to THRIVE. I started my own stock brokerage firm, developing a                          * SYSTEM OF SELLING that within a year made me a multi-millionaire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 215C-G   A SNAPSHOT OF JORDAN'S CHILDHOOD HOME, then OF H CURRENT ESTATE, FOLLOWED BY EXAMPLES OF WEALTH: his sportscars, Naomi in a bikini, stock footage of a jet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From these humble middle-class beginnings, I now live here...with my beautiful wife and kids...living the lifestyle of our dreams...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 215H     THE SEMINAR.   Jordan high-fives attendees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I'm passing along the secrets to my success in my 90-minute free seminar, "Jordan Belfort's Straight Line Persuasion."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 215J     FIRST TESTIMONIAL.    A MAN holds a framed check

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have here in my hand, framed, is a check for twenty-seven thousand four hundred and thirty-seven dollars and sixty-three cents that I netted from one deal after attending Jordan Belfort's, um, Straight Line Persuasion seminar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 215K     JORDAN, on a yacht with NAOMI and some MODELS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nobody stopping you from                      * making millions. There is nobody                      * holding you back from financial                       * freedom.                                              * (to Naomi)                                       * Thank You Sweet Heart.                                * (back to camera)                                 * Don't just sit at home or the life                    * of your dreams will sail right                        * past you.                                             *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 215L     TESTIMONIAL #2.    A COUPLE in a kitschy living

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks to the Straight Line System, we could afford this home and now we're living the lives of our dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 215M   A HELICOPTER descends to a helipad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've changed all these people's lives and I can change yours, too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It touches down and Jordan jumps out to address us --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So come to my seminar!! The life of your dreams is only a decision away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and BAM! gets clothes-lined by Agent Denham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON JORDAN'S HANDS, at last in cuffs.     PAN UP TO HIM, looking none-too-pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one takes the cake. It was Rugrat, he'd been busted down in Miami, and guess who the fuck with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean-Jacques Saurel is handcuffed by Feds as Rugrat looks on crying, handcuffed nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were the odds? There had to be ten thousand Swiss bankers in Geneva and I choose the one dumb enough to get himself arrested on U.S. soil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK!   Saurel gets his mug shot taken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even more ironic was he'd gotten himself indicted on charges that had nothing to fucking do with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROCKY AOKI, Japanese, 50s, is led out in handcuffs by a MAN in an FBI windbreaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something about laundering drug money through offshore boat racing and a guy named Rocky Aoki, the founder of Benihana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smiling Rocky Aoki looks on as a HIBACHI CHEF expertly dices shrimp on a sizzling grill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beni-fucking-hana! Why would God be so cruel as to choose a chain of fucking Hibachi Restaurants to bring me down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saurel lays on the bed, smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long story short was Saurel ratted me out, but not before he ratted out Chantalle, who it turns out he'd been fucking every time she went to Switzerland!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chantalle emerges from the bathroom naked.     Laughing, runs and jumps in bed with Saurel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his criminal attorney NOLAN DRAGER, 40s, next to him, Jordan stands before a JUDGE, being arraigned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was indicted for money laundering, securities fraud and an endless list of other shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leafing through a                             * subpoena)                                     * One count engaging in conspiracy                    * to commit securities fraud. Two                     * counts securities fraud. One                        * count engaging in conspiracy to                     * commit money laundering. Twenty-                    * one counts money laundering. One                    * count obstruction of justice.                       * (gives Jordan a                                * withering glare)                              * Bail is set at ten million dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Judge bangs the gavel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan walks with Nolan Drager, who flips through the subpoena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is...well, it's not good.                      * It's pretty bad actually. How                       * much money do you have, Jordan?                     *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can make bail.                                    *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mean the ten million, I                     * mean for legal fees. Cuz if you                     * want to fight this thing, it's                      * gonna be expensive. Like, sell-                     * everything-you-own-expensive.                       *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan exits the building. He's fucked and he knows it. He sees beautiful Naomi waiting for him beside a limosine; life isn't totally hopeless. He approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nay, thank God. I'm so glad you're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They embrace. He can't see her expression: she'd rather be anywhere else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages      3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SKYLAR AND PARKER, playing with a NANNY and Rocky the dog. Jordan watches them, sitting by his pool, drinking an O'Douls, weighing his options. Donnie pops into the yard, in "Uncle Donnie" mode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, everybody! How're the happiest people in Long Island? Hi, Rocky!! (joining Jordan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hate that fucking dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about it. It's getting old, starting to shit inside the house again. Jordan offers Donnie an O'Douls; Donnie declines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing, brother?     How was the food in jail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lobster Newburg sucked.     They gave me some jewelry though. He shows off the electronic bracelet around his ankle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonder if they got one in my size. Fuckin' Rugrat, that wig-wearin' hump. Tell you one thing: I'm never eating at Benihana's again. Where's Naomi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside.    Pissed. Donnie sees Naomi in a window.      He waves but she bare registers him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up her ass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had to mortgage the home to make bail. Probably gonna hafta sell it to pay my lawyers. If we fight this thing. Donnie weighs that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Feds say anything about coming after the rest of us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan thinks, then shakes his head no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, we're all behind you. Everyone at the office. (he removes an envelope, hands it to Jordan) We bought back your mortgage. All the founding partners threw in a million apiece. Figured none of us would have it if it weren't for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan's profoundly touched. Donnie squeezes his shoulder. A real moment of friendship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta fight this thing, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said, loyalty meant a lot to me. Without your friends and family standing behind you, you're fucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan sits with Nolan Drager across from FBI Agent Denham, U.S. Attorney LUCAS SOLOMON, 50s, and Assistant U.S. Attorney ROCHELLE APPLEBAUM, 30s, humorless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a term we have around                       * here, we don't like to use it                       * often, only when circumstances                      * dictate. It's called a "Grenada."                   * Inspired by our government's                        * invasion in 1983 of the island                      * nation of only 90,000 people,                       * basically it stands for any case                    * we get which is pretty much unlose-                 * able. We could show up late and                     * drunk to court, fuck up left-right-                 * and-center and still we'd win.                      * Mr. Belfort, you, sir, are a                        * "Grenada."                                          *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf of Wall Street   Buff Revised Pages   3/5/13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're looking at real prison                       * time. Money laundering gets you                     * as much as 20 years. Case                           * couldn't be stronger if we'd have                   * caught you with your cash in your                   * mattress.                                           * Solomon pushes a box full of evidence across the table. Jordan eyeballs Denham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read the discovery.                                 *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That your life's work in the box?                   *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan, you rotting in jail til                     * your kids're outta college isn't                    * our ambition here. You weren't                      * the only one involved in all this.                  * We think those folks deserve their                  * day in court too.                                   *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I get the sense there's an offer in the air? If so, let's                      * put it on the table.                                *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full cooperation. A comprehensive list of all coconspirators spanning the last seven years and he agrees to wear a wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to rat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want your cooperation in --                      *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
